name: recency
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of being recent, or the degree to which something is recent: Do photographic memories depend on recency? The recency of exposure to stressful events is often a critical factor in determining their impact on child behaviour.
More examplesFewer examplesTable I shows prevalence by age, sex, and recency of the symptom.Due to the recency of the cancer, the insurance company would not give cover.The recency of a prospective customer's last mail-order purchase is a relatively good indicator of overall interest in mail-order offers.
